diagnosis.final_diagnosis: acute-on-chronic type B aortic dissection with rupture
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with a history of aortic dissection and imaging revealed a ruptured descending thoracic aortic aneurysm resulting in right hemothorax and hemorrhagic shock. Key findings include the discovery of a new connection between the true and false lumens, leading to the diagnosis of acute-on-chronic dissection.
